#BREAKING 

Gemini Adds Support for $BNB Trading and Custody

#Bitcoin $BTC

Canton Token Surges 27% on DTCC Tokenization Plans   #Canton  Coin has rallied approximately 27% over the past week following the Depository Trust & Clearing Corporation's announcement of plans to tokenize U.S. Treasury securities on the Canton Network. The gains outpaced the broader cryptocurrency market, which remained largely flat during the same period.  DTCC revealed Dec. 17 that it would tokenize a portion of U.S. Treasuries held at its Depository Trust Company subsidiary using the #CantonNetwork  infrastructure. The organization operates post-trade infrastructure for U.S. securities markets, with subsidiaries processing about $3.7 quadrillion in securities transactions last year.  Frank La Salla, DTCC CEO, stated the collaboration establishes a roadmap for bringing real-world, high-value #tokenization  use cases to market. The initiative will begin with U.S. Treasury securities before expanding to a broader range of DTC-eligible assets, he said.  Canton Network operates as a permissioned blockchain designed for regulated financial institutions to issue and settle tokenized real-world assets. Canton Coin serves as the network's native token, supporting transactions and core network operations.  The token's performance contrasted sharply with major cryptocurrencies during the week. Bitcoin and Ethereum both declined approximately 0.5%, while $BNB  fell 0.9%, and Solana dropped around 3.3%, reports Cointelegraph.  Tokenization of #real-world  assets has emerged as a significant development in 2025, with total distributed value more than tripling from roughly $5.6 billion at the end of 2024 to approximately $19 billion currently, RWA.xyz data shows. U.S. Treasury products account for a substantial portion of that #expansion .  Around $9 billion in Treasury debt has been tokenized, up from approximately $3.9 billion at the start of the year.

Gemini, described as the third-largest crypto exchange in the United States, announced that it has launched trading and custody support for BNB. BNB is the native asset of the BNB Chain ecosystem, originally issued by Binance in 2017, and is commonly used to pay trading and network fees. Kraken already supports BNB, while Coinbase has added BNB to its listing roadmap but has not yet launched trading.
https://t.co/N5R8cTGRSr

In a significant move for U.S. crypto investors, Gemini has added BNB to its platform. This decision by the third-largest U.S. exchange provides new opportunities for traders and signals a shifting competitive landscape.
https://bitcoinworld.co.in/gemini-adds-bnb-trading-custody/

Binance founder #CZ   confirmed that all users affected by the recent Trust Wallet #hack   will be fully reimbursed, stating funds are ‚ÄúSAFU.‚Äù  The exploit impacted approximately $7 million across multiple assets, including BTC, ETH, and $BNB  .  The vulnerability was isolated to #TrustWallet   Browser Extension version 2.68; mobile apps and other extension versions were not affected.  Trust Wallet identified the issue on December 24, with exploitation occurring on December 25, and released a patched version 2.69 shortly after.  The reimbursement will be covered directly by Trust Wallet, not users or third parties. #BNBChain#

#BNB

$BNB Serious Warning to All Binance Users


What has happened in the UK is a real warning signal for Binance users worldwide. By announcing an official partnership with Kryptos and enforcing it in line with the 31 January deadline, Binance has clearly demonstrated that, under regulatory pressure, it prioritizes its own survival over user privacy and user interests.


This is not merely a ‚Äútechnical‚Äù or ‚Äútax-related‚Äù partnership. It represents a direct transfer of risk, oversight, and legal consequences from the exchange to the user. The message is unmistakable: in critical moments, users are the first to be sacrificed.


However, if real unity and solidarity emerge among traders and users, it becomes possible to make a collective, informed decision to leave such platforms and turn this into a powerful lesson for other exchanges. A lesson that makes it clear users are not powerless‚Äîand that trust is not something to be traded away. Ignoring this warning today may lead to serious and irreversible consequences tomorrow.
